events.name: A Tour of Firebase
events.description:
• What we'll do
"Firebase helps you build better mobile apps and grow your business."

Apparently....

Firebase started off as a data store and has since merged to become an all singing all dancing application framework. It now offers Authentication, Authorisation, Messaging, File Storage, Data Storage, Cloud Functions...

In our first meet up of the year we will be hearing from users who have been putting Firebase to work in their organisations. If you are such a person then give us a shout we would love to hear from you

Conor Woods will be talking to us about his experiences with Firebase including FireStore and Authentication options.

Patrick Walker will be doing a whistle-stop tour of the Firebase greatest hits with a demo app.

We may even have a live demo of us doing some of those features...

• What to bring

• Important to know
Neil Armstrong may have been the first man to walk on the moon but Buzz Aldrin was the first man to urinate on the moon. So it may belong to him. We'll check on that.

events.name: Introduction to Kubernetes
events.description:
Long promised, it's finally here... Originally promised last June, we're finally going to Introduce Kubernetes Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. Built out of Borg, Googles original tool for managing and maintaining it's servers and data centres, Kubernetes was open sourced and donated to the Cloud Native Computing Foundation in 2014, and has grown in popularity with the rise of containerisation.

We will be taking a brief walk through Kubernetes - what it is and how it does it, before using it to set up and deploy an application on our own cluster. No sys admin or development experience is required, or presumed so everyone should be able to follow along

• What to bring
Please bring a laptop if you want to follow along with the demonstration. A Google Cloud account could be useful if you want to deploy to the cloud - signing up will give you a free year

• Important to know
We're expecting this to be busy, so please consider if you're able to make it before signing up!

events.name: IWD Women TechMakers Summit 2018

venue.name: W5
venue.address_1: SSE Arena (The Odyssey), 2 Queens Quay, Belfast BT3 9QQ

events.description:
• What we'll do
In it's 3rd year, Belfast's edition of the global Women Techmakers event has grown with the community, and this year we're responding with our biggest event yet - a full day where we hear from speakers who will inspire, motivate, enthuse and relate to our audience of everyone, with talks highlighting the achievements of our local women techmakers. Further details of speakers and tickets available on the website: http://www.womentechmakersbelfast.com/

To know what to expect:
There are interactive workshops on Friday 13th and a full day's conference on Saturday April 14th at W5. Both events are open to all people of any gender.

• Important to know
The event will be catered. There will also be childcare available for the summit.

events.name: Google I/O 2018 Extended
events.description:
Come join us as we ruminate on I/O 2018!

Slightly different format this year. Rather than watching the keynote we're going
to have a couple of presenters curating a session and then giving a few talking points/background on it.

Emma Mulholland, Organizer of ProductTank and Product Camp Belfast, will be sharing a session on design sprints followed by some of her personal insights into that area.

Our second session is going to be with Gareth Fleming who is going to keep us abreast of all the excitement and announcements regarding Android

We'll also have a recap of the main news from I/O and the biggest announcements.

HouseKeeping - Remember to use the side door at Ormeau Baths after hours!

ps : it sadly turns out ruminate doesn't mean drink rum

events.name: Tensorflow
events.description:
Join us as we hear from local professionals who are using Tensorflow in their day to day work

Lorenzo leads axial3D Machine Learning team, working on the development of advanced algorithms to analyse patients 3D medical scans, focusing on achieving the highest anatomical fidelity of the 3D printed models as well as help shape the company's product portfolio. With a PhD in Physics, Lorenzo gained experience in companies such as Alert Logic, Mintel as well as within academia.

In this talk we will present the latest developments on three dimensional medical image labelling and syntactic segmentation using fully convolutional neural networks for the detection and recognition of human tissues. We will show how such application is central to the development of a number of key diagnostic tools with a particular focus on 3D printing for pre-operative planning. The necessary hardware required to train and evaluate such system will be reviewed, and how axial3D is using this technology to help clinicians provide better healthcare through the adoption of 3D printing.

Brief intro on axial3D:
axial3D is committed to helping the healthcare sector provide a better service to patients by adopting 3D printing, AI and the most cutting edge image processing technology. We offers a bespoke 3D printing service for radiologists and surgeons, an intuitive and easy to use managed software infrastructure designed for any hospital wanting to set up their own 3D printing lab, as well as a fully automated online anatomy recognition platform that can be used to generate 3D printable files directly from the patient scans. Since its foundation in 2015 by Daniel Crawford, the company has been growing dramatically through seed and series-A investments, collaborations with Academia, medical institutions and private companies, attending numerous conferences and workshops within the healthcare sector as well as promoting AI, 3D printing and new cutting edge technology in the local community of developers and technologists.

Presenter: Jonny Whyte, an R&D software engineer for Mintel with a Physics PhD background, who has been working on ML solutions over the past few years.

Title: From Python to TensorFlow
Description: This talk aims to explain some of the basic machine learning techniques, through writing algorithms using python and numpy, and then show how they translate to the functionalities in TensorFlow, so you have a better idea of what is going on "under the hood".

Presenter : Chris Nixon, a programming nerd interested in everything from embedded development to PL research and all the bits in between

Description : A quick talk about commonly encountered performance pitfalls when starting out with Tensorflow and how to avoid them

*Pizza being provided by our sponsors and friends at University of Ulster*

events.name: Introduction to Flutter with Matt Sullivan
events.description:
We're joined by very special guest Matt Sullivan from the Flutter team who is going to give an overview and introduction to Flutter

What is Flutter - Flutter, https://flutter.io/ , is one of the most talked about technologies in Mobile development today. Flutter aims to help you build beautiful, expressive and performant experiences on a huge range of devices (IOS and Android supported)

Flutter is free and open-source. Looks to leverage existing code and give access to native code

Schedule
Intro to Flutter
---
Follow along with a Codelab intro to Flutter - https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/flutter/#0

Feel free to bring your own device to follow along but it's optional. We'll have some poor sucker sharing their screen there :)

Food/Drinks to be announced later. We're delighted to be helped and sponsored by Ulster University's School of Computing again.

events.name: Zero to App: Rapid Development with Firebase with Erik Haddad
events.description:
On the night after Halloween​ we will be looking at something decidedly unscary - Firebase. Firebase helps mobile and web developers create extraordinary apps. It abstracts complex infrastructure and simplifies the development process.

Erik Haddad (https://twitter.com/erikhaddad), a UX engineer at Google, is joining us fresh from the Firebase summit in Prague. He will be presenting "Zero to App: Rapid Development with Firebase". He will show how developers can build the best user experience in the shortest amount of time, all without having to spin up servers or manage infrastructure

events.name: Introduction to Apps Script
events.description:
Join us for our first meetup of 2019 which is a hands on session with Google App Script.

What is App Script you ask? It's a javascript platform that lets you extend and enhance the G Suite of products. Want Google Docs to offer a new feature well the power is in your hands to make it happen. Even better than that there's a marketplace so you can make it happen for others too!

We'll be undertaking some code labs to build on top of sheets, map and mail and google drive too. So bring a laptop if you would like to partake and failing that you can follow along as we walk through it on screen

We're being hosted and looked after thanks to the incredible team at Flexera (https://www.flexera.com/)

Had some difficulty organizing falafel for the numbers so there will be pizza from Pizza Co and a few falafel for anyone who is vegan/dairy free.

If you have any dietary restrictions please let us know by messaging organizers or me directly on [masked]

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Kubernetes in the Google Cloud
events.description:
Want to get started with Kubernetes, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs on Kubernetes.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Agenda:
6:00pm: Welcome and getting Access
6:15pm: Introduction to Docker/Hello Node Kubernetes
7:30pm: Break
7:45pm: Hello Node Kubernetes/Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes
9:00pm: Event ends

Currently no plans for food but if that changes the meetup will be updated!

events.name: IWD Women TechMakers Belfast Summit 2019
events.description:
Women Techmakers (WTM) is Google’s global program and brand for women in technology. As part of the global event series, we’ve hosted a WTM Summit Belfast since 2016, in celebration of International Women’s Day (IWD).

Attend!
Help us celebrate diversity in our local tech community by joining us to hear from a variety of speakers sharing their work, passions and hobbies in lightning talks or longer talks.
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/women-techmakers-belfast-2019-tickets-53994737714

Speak!
If you are interested in speaking at this event, please see our Call for Papers, we'd love to hear from you. Submissions are open at: https://www.papercall.io/wtmbelfast2019

Important to know
- We encourage (and hope to see!) people of all genders, backgrounds, technical abilities, religious affiliations, races and ages to attend!
- The event will be catered, please note any dietary requirements on the eventbrite ticket.
- There will also be childcare available for the summit, please register for a separate childcare ticket on the eventbrite page

Any questions please get in touch :)

More info: womentechmakersbelfast.com

events.name: Google Cloud
events.description:
We will be joined by James Bunch. James is a Technical Architect, currently working on Big Data problems in banking. Before that, he spent 20 years building critical software systems for aerospace, defence and government clients, in various engineering roles.

Title: Big Data on the Google Cloud Platform
Abstract: The Google Cloud Platform offers an enticing range of technologies for building Big Data systems. In this talk, I'll describe my experience of the reality of moving from on-premise Hadoop systems to GCP.

Do services like BigQuery and Dataproc live up the hype? Can the machine learning APIs scale to handle large data volumes? And how much of this is really 'serverless'?

Then Patrick Walker will walk through a code lab on Cloud Vision API which is a machine learning image classification service available on the Google Cloud Platform via a rest API. We'll classify images from the aww sub-reddit and it'll be probably fine. I wouldn't worry about it.

Agenda :

19:15 James Bunch
19:45 Break
20:00 Awwvision - An introduction to the Cloud Vision API via pictures of dogs and cats and stuff
20:30 Lightning Talk Space

If you have a topic on Google Cloud you would like to talk about please reach out to us.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - IOT in the Google Cloud
events.description:
Want to get started on IOT in the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! We ran one earlier this year on Kubernetes but this time the focus is on IOT!

https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/49 <- is the Quest

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

We're once again being hosted by the fantastic team at Flexera. We're massively grateful for the support that we receive both from Google and the local community that allows us to put these events on

events.name: We need to talk about front-end
events.description:
Before we all stuff ourselves full of chocolate eggs, we are running a meetup inspired by lovely front-end goodness!

Our agenda:

Cloud and Back again: A devs tale by Philip Smyth
Big Data on the Google Cloud Platform - James Bunch
A how-to of Google's Workbox for PWAs - Brian Mullan
Introduction to Cypress.IO - Patrick Walker

Thanks to Puppet for having us and who will be providing food and drinks!

events.name: I/O Extended 2019
events.description:
Join us as we catch up on all the big news and announcements from IO but with a local flavour.

There's a veritable cornucopia of sessions, codelabs and announcements at IO every year and sure it can be overwhelming so come kick it with us and members of the local tech community as they give their highlights and give you a curated taste of the very best of IO.

We'll be using this informal catchup to learn what's interesting about

* Android (Gareth Fleming)
* AR/VR (Owen Atkinson and Jake Young)
* Games (Tina Lauro Pollock)
* Front End Development (Cailín Millar)
* Cloud (Simon Hewitt)

events.name: AR/VR Technologies with guest Doug Sillars
events.description:
We're delighted to be joined by Doug Sillars (https://twitter.com/dougsillars) who will be giving us a wonderful talk on AR/VR.

“Virtual ARt Gallery: building with Augmented Reality” on how to use AR/VR technologies on the web.

Doug is is a freelance mobile performance expert, having helped thousands of developers speed up their mobile apps and websites. A Google Developer Expert and the author of O’Reilly’s “High Performance Android Apps,” Doug regularly speaks at conferences, and blogs at dougsillars.com. He is currently working as a freelance digital nomad, traveling with his family in Europe.

"The Happy Place"
The Happy Place is a VR story created by four animation students in their final year at Ulster University.

The story takes place inside a loading area where you are a beta tester for a revolutionary new app. This app allows you to experience your own personal "Happy Place" based on your preferences and memories. However when things go wrong in the loading area; things arent as happy as they seem.

@lukemcneice Innovation Lead, at Kainos Software talks gives a glimpse into what drives Kainos R&D and talking about recent Kainos Innovation projects, why immersive technology is interesting now and will be more interesting in the future.

Luke McNeice

Luke, Innovation Lead, maker, gamer and award-winning hacker works across a broad range of technologies and domains spending his time building teams, finding new tools and developing people at Kainos. Luke founded Immersive Tech NI, consults for a range of start-ups and UK government teams on Innovation, management and engineering. He also dismembers Furbies in his spare time. You’ll find him scavenging at the edge of everything on twitter:@lukemcneice

Luke Donnelly and Niall Haslam from axial3D will give a brief overview of their experience implementing mixed reality in the healthcare space. As a medical imaging company axial3D work with images and volumes in a web based client. Mixed reality seemed like a natural extension of the visualisation work they were doing. In this lightning talk they will describe the problem they were trying to address and the ability of some of the existing mixed reality tools and frameworks to address those problems.

events.name: Let's Go
events.description:
Let’s Go

Go (or Golang) is a programming language that was released in 2009, designed and developed in Google to simplify designing and developing modern applications

We have joined up with Raise Ventures’ Decode programme to offer a one day Go workshop, where starting from nothing we will learn the language, develop and application and make it available online.

The workshop is aimed at people who have some programming experience but may not have ever used Go.

This is a paid for event, with all of the proceeds from tickets will be redistributed to the Go community to teach technical skills and to foster diversity in Go.

Please note, if the cost for this event is the reason you would be unable to attend please get in touch as we have some sponsored tickets available.
events.how_to_find_us: Raise is in Commercial Court, in the same alley as the Duke of York. We'll have someone at the door on the day to make sure you get in

events.name: Angular and Firebase - Together at Last
events.description:
When you hear the word Angular what first comes to mind? Robert Pattinsons jawline sure but what if I was to tell you that it's also a web development framework! Come find out about it and Firebase and using them seperately and together and then maybe together again

You may be asking "I already know Angular can I still come?" Ok but do you like adding ng to the start of a lot of words? of course you ngDO so come here and talk about Angular with people who are ngUSING it every ngBLOODY day

We're going to have speakers.

Sean Carlin "Integrating Googles FirebaseUI Auth with an Angular 8.0 application".

Colum Ferry "Integrating Googles Firebase Firestore and Cloud Storage with an Angular 8.0 application"

“Sean Carlin is a senior software engineer at SmashFly Technologies with a keen interest in Angular, typescript, .Net and all things cloud.”

“Colum Ferry is a coffee-powered JavaScript enthusiast working as a Graduate Software Engineer at SmashFly Technologies.”

Simon Hewitt, to my mind the best Simon, will then step through a codelab which acts as a good introduction to firebase. You'll learn how to use Firebase to easily create web applications by implementing and deploying a chat client using Firebase products and services.

All you need to bring with you is a thirst for knowledge and an appetite for destruction

events.name: Machine learning on Google Cloud
events.description:
This workshop will cover from beginners to in-depth content on Machine Learning on Google Cloud.
Starting from an introductory level, we will be advancing in difficulty with the succeeding
sessions. Attendees will be able to take training material home and continue from there with
support.

Agenda
This is a 4 hour training starting from 5 pm to 9 pm:
● 5:00 pm: Registration and refreshments
● 5:15 pm: A tour of Qwiklabs and GCP and getting started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
● 6:15 pm: Cloud Natural Language API: Qwik Start + Video Intelligence: Qwik Start
● 7:15 pm: Break
● 7:30 pm: Classify Images of Cloud Using Cloud ML API
● 8:15 pm: Implementing an AI Chatbot with Dialogflow
● 9:00 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 4 hours course, participants will be able to:
● Get hands-on practice with the Google Cloud Platform’s fundamental tools and
services.
● Understand how Qwiklabs platform works for personal practice
Audience
● You will come in with little or no prior cloud knowledge, and come out with practical
experience that you can apply to your first GCP project
● Application ​developers, Web Developers, ​Cloud ​Solutions Architects, ​DevOps
​Engineers, ​IT managers
● Individuals ​using ​Google ​Cloud ​Platform to ​create ​new ​solutions ​or ​to ​integrate
existing ​systems, application environments, ​and ​infrastructure ​with the ​Google ​Cloud
​Platform
Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
● Assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Cloud
Platform. It is expected that students have an information technology or computing
background, and have some hands-on familiarity with administering computing
systems. Prior work with shell environments / command line interfaces will be helpful
for completing the labs in this series.
The trainer

Andres-Leonardo Martinez-Ortiz a.k.a almo is a member of the Google Engineering team,
leading Google Cloud Ecosystem program in Europe. Based in Zurich, he drives the success of
Google's developer products and the Open Web by creating a thriving ecosystem of
developers. He meets with experts and partners in large companies, startups, universities and
enterprises, promoting Open standards and Google technologies. He is also a member of
IEEE, ACM, Linux Foundation and Computer Society.
events.how_to_find_us: Clockwise part of River House on main street.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam - Write your first Flutter App
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam!

We kick off with a talk and demo from Kevin Cowan on "Building a simple Flutter App which receives Firebase messages".

Together we'll then work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.. This will include building YOUR first flutter app as well as getting an introduction to DART the language which powers Flutter

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

events.name: Web development with AMP workshop
events.description:
Come along to our Web development with AMP Workshop by
Fellyph Cintra!

The goal here is to help us understand why we should use AMP and what are key points from the platform. This will be aimed at beginner to intermediate level but everyone is welcome.

It will be a hands on workshop so attendees, please bring laptops to follow along with the exercises! We will be walked through the steps necessary to convert a regular HTML page in an AMP page and build a AMP web application with interactive components.

Our Agenda:

-Why AMP?
-How AMP helps
-Requirements
-Starting our journey
-Validation and AMP Cache
-Exercise 1: Using AMP validator
-The anatomy of an AMP Page
-Exercise 2: Converting our HTML Solution
-Web Components?
-Exercise 3: First Components
-Exercise 4: Embedding Video
-Exercise 5: Creating an image SlideShow
-Exercise 6: Adding Sharing Links
-Exercise 7: Building a slide menu
Questions!

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere - Frontend to Backend and Mobile In-between
events.description:
It’s our first Google Developer Group / Kotlin User Group crossover event!

Join us at the Oh Yeah Music Centre for our first Kotlin/Everywhere event, where we are going to show how we can use Kotlin to write for the full stack.

Opening the evening, Garth Gilmour will demonstrate Kotlin targeting JavaScript, providing the ability to write to the browser.

With the declaration at Google I/O that “Android development will become increasingly Kotlin-first”, Gareth Fleming will give an overview as to why “If you’re starting a new project, you should write it in Kotlin”.

Next, come watch a back end engineer that has successfully managed to avoid the JVM for 20 years, set down Go and investigate a whole new world. Simon Hewitt will give his impressions of writing Kotlin for back end services. Spoiler, he didn’t hate it.

Finally, Richard Gibson will show that Kotlin is not just everywhere, but it’s also here and now as he talks about and demonstrates the new product he and a team has built written entirely in Kotlin

The event is sponsored by Instil (https://instil.co) and Jetbrains (https://jetbrains.com)

6:[masked] - arrival and food (Boojums)
6.45 - 7:00 - intro and welcome
7:00 - 7.30 - Speaker 1 - Garth Gilmour
7.30 - 8:00 - Speaker 2 - Gareth Fleming
8:[masked] - Speaker 3 - Simon Hewitt
8.30 - 9:00 - Speaker 4 - Richard Gibson

events.name: Firebase with Doug Stevenson
events.description:
We're delighted to have Doug Stevenson @CodingDoug who is a Firebase Developer Advocate join us after the Firebase Summit in Madrid.

Easy, scalable backends for Android developers
In the past, engineering teams typically split “frontend” and “backend” responsibilities. As an Android developer, you almost certainly slotted into the “frontend” category, with no responsibility on the backend. And if you do want to work on the backend for an app, it can be taxing to learn new tools and languages, while being responsible for managing and scaling a server farm.

Today, with “serverless” backends becoming popular, server management and scaling is being fully automated, and you can use many of the same tools and languages you use for Android development. Do you want to write Kotlin everywhere? There’s a solution for you! Join this talk to survey some serverless options provided by Google, see some demos, and figure out which options are right for you.

We'll also have Andy Hayes from Puppet speaking too. Andrew is a Senior Software Engineer at Puppet working on Vulnerability Remediation. Andrew has 7+ years of experience working on DevOps and Cloud Technologies.

events.name: Pi European Roadshow
events.description:
Don't miss out on our next event taking place in Puppet on October 2nd!

Together with our friends at WTM Belfast we are delighted to welcome Emma Haruka Iwao, Gillian Armstrong and Deepa Mann-Kler who will each share with us their journey, achievements and learnings along the way.

Emma Haruka Iwao is Japanese computer scientist and cloud developer advocate at Google who recently calculated the world's most accurate value of pi (π); which included 31.4 trillion digits, exceeding the previous record of 22 trillion. Calculating Pi has been Emma's childhood dream and her talk will explain how the small dream grew to the new world record and will also cover a brief history of Pi computation, the nature of the calculation, the architecture and challenges.

Gillian Armstrong is an experienced full-stack developer, currently helping teams at Liberty IT explore and adopt Cognitive Technologies. Gillian frequently speaks at conferences and blogs about technology, especially around the topics of Cloud and AI. Gillian's talk will cover her journey into Cloud, Serverless and Applied AI and the implications on development and user experience.

Deepa Mann-Kler is an award winning visual artist; CEO of Neon a health technology company; Visiting Professor In Immersive Futures with Ulster University and serves as a non-executive director. As a thought leader she speaks at conferences on the intersection of creativity, technology, innovation, diversity, health, wellbeing and storytelling. As an artist she has a strong focus on public art neon installations, notably Lumiere Durham 2019; London 2016 and 2013 in Derry/Londonderry UK City of Culture. Deepa authored the first report into racism in NI "Out Of The Shadows” in 1998.

Big thank you to our sponsor, Puppet for hosting!

Agenda and running order will be posted soon. If you've any questions please get in touch

events.name: Android
events.description:
We're going to be discussing everything Android in October.

We're delighted to be joined by Raul Portales. Raul is a Software Engineer with a love for computers, electronics and gadgets in general since as long as he remembers. He jumped into
Android as soon as it was released. Raul has worked on social networks, education, healthcare and even founded a gaming studio and a consultancy company. Specialized on mobile and UX, he speaks frequently at conferences and meetups.

During this talk Raul will show how to configure and use Vizzy for visual testing your app (platform agnostic)
You have your Ul tests, and they verify that a button with the right text is on screen... but how do you check that the style is consistent, or that the padding hasn't changed, or anything about the actual visual representation of the UI.
You can do it manually, but what if there were a tool that simplify that? That is what Vizzy does.

We also will be welcoming Jordan Colgan from Instil. Jordan is a software engineer at Instil( https://instil.co/) and is working on the ShopKeep Android project,

Talk Title: Past, Present, and Future of coroutines in (ShopKeep) Android

Description: A look at the adoption and evolution of coroutines in the ShopKeep Android project, along with lessons learnt and a look at the new scope updates.

Our third speaker is Conor Devine. Conor is from Derry. Currently working at Allstate Northern Ireland. I have a couple years experience in Android development. Graduated with a first class honours in Computer Science from Ulster University last summer. Enjoying my volunteering experience on the Time To Code program teaching primary five children how to code. Always open to new opportunities

Conor will be presenting a short powerpoint presentation on Android App Bundle with Dynamic Delivery. This will include some theory behind what this is, the benefits it brings and a simple demonstration of a POC app created.

We also are very keen to hear from anyone who may be at Uni or just finished up who has potentially done a project in Android and would like to give a little demo/presentation of the work. If that's you hit us up!

Massive thank you to our sponsors for this event. Shopkeep (https://www.shopkeep.com/careers) for the Venue and drinks and Slice (https://slicelife.com/careers) who will be feeding us and just generally being dead on.

Also thanks again to instil ( https://instil.co/) for their continued support

events.name: Women Techmakers 2020 Public Speaking Workshop! (Beginners welcome!)
events.description:
Women Techmakers is Google’s brand and network for women in technology, set up with the aim of highlighting brilliant women within the technology industry to be seen by all - inspiring, educating and creating discussion & ideas. Women Techmakers Belfast is a conference that has been running on International Women's Day since 2016 as a celebration of the technical achievements of local women.

This workshop is hosted by Women Techmakers Belfast to help attendees to hone their skills in public speaking and get them ready to submit an abstract to a tech conference!

No prior knowledge or experience is necessary; just a healthy enthusiasm and a willingness to learn about speaking in public regarding technical, business or work-related topics.

The workshop will take place in an inclusive and welcoming environment, taking you all the way from ideas generation through to tips and tricks to make public speaking easier and more effective, to writing a short description of your very own talk! You will also get an insight into the general process for submitting to a conference, and get familiar with the jargon used within the conferencing industry.

Additionally, you will get the opportunity to explore different topics and come up with an idea for a talk in a collaborative way, all under the guidance of two seasoned speakers who have presented at international conferences such as AppSec EU, DevOpsDays Galway, WLCW 2017, and Codemotion Amsterdam.

The event will run from 18.15 to 20.50 in the Event Space at Farset Labs.

-----

The refreshments for this event are kindly sponsored by ShopKeep! Thank you so much!

-----

If you attend this workshop and identify as a woman, we would very much encourage you to submit your talk to the Women Techmakers 2020 conference, however it is not compulsory, and all gender identities are welcome at this event! :)

events.name: Machine Learning in the Cloud with Marc Cohen
events.description:
Marc Cohen is a Google Cloud Developer advocate and will be in town to give us a talk and demo of using Tensorflow in Google Cloud.

He'll start out with some background information on Machine Learning, and how it's being used at Google, and we'll follow along with a lab exercise using Google Cloud Tensorflow Processing Units (TPU) to build a Digit Classification model.

This will be an interactive class so please bring your laptops!
events.how_to_find_us: The front door may be locked but there will be someone on hand to let you in

events.name: Women Techmakers 2020 Launch!
events.description:
Women Techmakers Belfast 2020 Launch Event!

Join us on January 30th @ Puppet Belfast as we celebrate the launch of WTM Belfast 2020 with our wonderful collaborators Corgi, Women Who Code Belfast and Women In Tech (Lean In).

Come along to find out more about the Women Techmakers initiative, what we do in Belfast and speaking at our conference taking place Saturday 4th April. You'll also hear from our collaborators and of course, have an opportunity to network prior to the conference so you'll have buddies to go with!

Food & drinks will be provided thanks to our generous host and sponsor, Puppet. Please let us know of any dietary requirements when registering your place.

Agenda:
(* Timings are approximate*)
6.00pm Arrival & Food
6.30pm Welcome
6.40pm WTM Belfast
6.50pm WWCode Belfast
7.10 pm WiT Lean In
7.25pm Corgi
7.40pm Speak at WTM
7.50pm Celebrate with us
8.00pm Close

About Women Techmakers (WTM)
Women Techmakers (WTM) is Google’s global program and brand for women in technology. As part of the global event series, we’ve hosted a WTM Summit Belfast since 2016, in celebration of International Women’s Day (IWD).

About Women Who Code
A global nonprofit dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers offering events from, technical workshops, networking events, hackathons, social events, panel discussions to lightning talks and collaborative events with others.

About Corgi
An online community and meet-up group designed for undergraduate women in tech, based in Belfast. Giving students in the field of technology the opportunity to connect, learn and support each other throughout the early stages of their career.

About Women in Tech (Lean In)
A Lean In circle for women whom work in any area of the tech industry. The group is to support each other, learn new skills, and encourage each other to take on new challenges. Together, we are going further and standing up for equality.

About Puppet
Puppet’s core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn’t stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet’s open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.
As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. Puppet are hiring now!

Code of Conduct 📃
Women Techmakers Belfast events are open to everyone and we are committed to providing a harassment-free experience for attendees. All organisers, speakers, sponsors, partners, volunteers and attendees at any WTM Belfast event are required to agree to the Code of Conduct http://bit.ly/2QPoEnn and Google Community and Event Guidelines and Anti-Harassment Policy https://www.google.com/events/policy/anti-harassmentpolicy.html
